recipe_name: Hot and cold ice cream with griddled figs and bananas
author: James Martin
method: First, cut each sheet of filo pastry in half and overlap them on top of each other.  Brush the filo pastry with the melted butter and add a scoop of vanilla ice cream in the centre.  Bunch up the filo to make a parcel, dust with icing sugar and place in a preheated oven at 220C/425F/Gas 7 for 2-3 minutes.  While the filo parcels are cooking, preheat a griddle pan and brush the bananas and figs with a little of the butter.  Griddle the bananas and figs on both sides and when cooked, place on a plate.  Remove the parcels from the oven and serve on the side of the plate. Drizzle with the honey, a further dusting of icing sugar and garnish with a sprig of mint.
ingredients: 2 bananas, peeled and halved ,  4 figs, halved ,  30g/1oz butter, melted ,  4 sheets filo pastry ,  icing sugar ,  4 scoops vanilla ice cream ,  4 tbsp honey ,  fresh mint, to garnish
